titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Special Collections, Grant Funded Materials
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Special Collections, Grant Funded Materials FA1839

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Special Collections, Grant Funded Materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of grant funded materials, including reports, correspondence, and publications, created by Ford Foundation grantees as part of, or in addition to, the agreed terms of their Ford Foundation grants. These materials span from the 1950s to the 2010s. Sometimes these files are referred to as "grant attachments." These materials are considered separate from the Ford Foundation historical grant files which contain organizational information, grant proposals, reports, documents outlining the terms of the grant, budgetary information, and signed grant agreement letters. Many of the grant-funded materials in this collection came to the Rockefeller Archive Center as part of a grant room clean-up project. Some files in the collection are annex and appendix materials that have been separated from a larger report. A small portion of the documents within folders are labelled numerically. Contextual information regarding the Ford Foundation grant under which the materials were created, including the name of the grantee, the dates of the grant, the grant number (ex: PA 09800953 or (06700190)), the grant purpose statement, the grant amount, and names of Ford Foundation program officers responsible for the grant have been added to the description field when they are identifiable.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center received seven accessions containing Grant Funded Materials from the Ford Foundation between 2019 and 2021 - Accessions 2020:012, 2019:055, 2019:097, 2019:118, 2019:088, 2020:032, 2021:010.

Educational Facilities Laboratories (05800096)

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Educational Facilities Laboratories (EFL) was an independent nonprofit research organization established by the Ford Foundation in 1958 with an appropriation of $4.5 million. The organization's goal was to help American schools and colleges improve their facilities through research and experimentation.

Over its 28-year existence, EFL spurred innovation in school architecture by sponsoring research projects and programs, holding conferences, and awarding grants to thousands of school districts, colleges, and nonprofit organizations throughout the United States and Canada. Committed to spreading the word of such advancement, EFL distributed more than two million copies of its publications on research, experimentation, and emerging trends.
